intro: Rhodohypoxis rubella var. thodiana, commonly known as the red-veined oxalis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae and is characterized by its striking, bright red veins on its heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are typically clustered in a dense inflorescence. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and as a houseplant.
